plugins.name: Sync Variables with Notion
plugins.description:
Synchronizes variables from a Notion database to a Figma document's Variable Collection. This is particularly useful for managing application text in Notion or supporting multiple languages.


üî• How to use


Sync collection tab

Connects a Notion database to a Figma Variable Collection and synchronizes their values. Settings are saved per Figma document.


1. Database ID

Specify the Notion database ID (Reference).


2. Integration token

First, create a new integration in Notion (Reference). Next, grant your integration page permissions (Reference). Enter the copied token.


3. Key property name

Specify the name of the Notion property that serves as the unique key for the variables (e.g., Name, Key, ID). Currently, title, formula, and text properties are supported as keys.


4. Collection name to create or update

Specify the name of the Figma Variable Collection to sync with. Existing local collection names will be suggested via autocomplete. If the specified collection doesn't exist, it will be created.


5. Add or reorder modes

Specify the Notion property names that correspond to Figma Variable Modes. These properties will hold the variable values for each mode (e.g., language).


  1. Adding modes:
  2. Enter a mode name in the textbox (e.g., ja, en, or other property names in your Notion database).
  3. Click the "Add" button to add it to the list.
  4. Reordering modes: Modes in the list can be reordered via drag and drop. This order will be reflected in the order of Figma variable modes.
  5. Removing modes: Click the X icon to the right of each mode name to remove that mode from the list.


After entering the information for steps 1-4, click the "Sync variable collection with Notion" button to start the synchronization. This process might take some time depending on the number of items in the database and the variables.


List tab

About list tab

Displays variables from the selected Collection. Only STRING type variables applicable to TEXT_CONTENT are shown. You can copy keys and values, and filter the list by key or value. Clicking on a row reveals the button described below.


"Apply variable to selected text" button

Select text layers in Figma and click the button to apply the variable.


Display mode

Select the Variable Mode (e.g., language) to display its corresponding values in the list.


About caching

When the target collection is a library collection, this plugin caches its information in client storage. This is done because fetching library collections with many variables can be time-consuming and might hit Figma's API rate limits. Clicking the "Refresh" button clears the cache and fetches the latest variable data.


Utilities tab

Provides several utility actions to help manage variables and their application to text layers.


Target collection

Select the Variable Collection to target for the actions. You can choose a collection or all collections.


Target text range

Select the scope for the actions: "Selection", "Current page", or "All pages". You can also choose whether to include text layers within components ("Include text within components") or instances ("Include text within instances") using the respective checkboxes.


Limit variable name

Optionally, enter text here to limit the "Bulk apply variables" action to only those variables whose names contain the specified text.


"Bulk apply variables" button

Automatically applies variables to text layers within the selected range. It matches text content with variable values across all modes in the target collection(s).


"Highlight applied variables" button

Visualizes variable usage on text layers. Text layers with variables applied are highlighted in blue, while those without are highlighted in red.


üìÆ Support

If you have any problems or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.


===


This plugin was created by Ryo Nakae üôé‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.


https://brdr.jp

https://x.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae
plugins.tagline: Sync text from Notion database to variable collection of Figma.

- Fixed an issue where caching would fail when selecting library collections with thousands of variables (now displays variable lists without caching)

plugins.name: flowwwww
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflows with flowwwww, the ultimate plugin for creating dynamic connectors between frames, components, and other objects in Figma. Whether you're designing user flows, wireframes, or complex diagrams, flowwwwwempowers you to create professional, customizable connections with ease.


Key Features

Intuitive Connector Creation

Select two frames or components, and flowwwww will instantly generate a connector between them.


Highly Customizable

Personalize your connectors with adjustable properties:

Stroke color and size.

Add text annotations to label your connectors for enhanced clarity.


Smart Obstacle Avoidance

Enable Obstacle Mode to automatically detect and avoid overlapping objects, ensuring clean and unobstructed connectors.

Perfect for complex designs where connectors need to navigate around other elements.



Use Cases

User Flows : Map out user journeys with clear, annotated connectors between screens.

Wireframing : Create structured layouts with precise connections between components.

Technical Diagrams : Build flowcharts, process maps, and other technical illustrations with ease.

Prototyping : Enhance your prototypes with interactive and visually appealing connectors.


How It Works

Install the flowwwww plugin from the Figma Community.

Select two frames, components, or rectangles that you want to connect.


Configure your connector settings (color, style, etc.) via the plugin interface.


Let flowwwww do the rest‚Äîwatch as it creates beautiful, dynamic connectors that adapt to your design.


Why Choose flowwwww?

flowwwww is more than just a connector tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity booster for designers who value precision, flexibility, and efficiency. With its robust feature set and seamless integration into Figma, flowwwww is the go-to solution for anyone looking to elevate their design workflow.


Feedback and Support

We‚Äôre committed to making flowwwww the best it can be! If you have any suggestions, encounter issues, or simply love the plugin, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Leave a comment on the Figma Community page or reach out to us directly.


Get Started Today

Install flowwwww now and experience the power of effortless connector creation. Simplify your design process and bring your ideas to life with clarity and precision.
plugins.tagline: Effortless Connector Creation for Figma

plugins.name: Calculator
plugins.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma‚Äôs native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

Improved handling of thousand separators (1,000 and 1.000)
Better detection of decimal points vs thousand separators
Support for both European (1.234,56) and American (1,234.56) number formats
Currency Support:
Added recognition of currency symbols ($, ‚Ç¨, ¬£, ‚Ç¥, ¬•, ‚Çø)
Support for currency codes (USD, EUR, GBP, UAH, JPY, BTC, ETH, USDT)
Handles currency notation at both start and end of numbers (e.g., "$1,000" and "1,000 USD")
Error Handling:
Added informative messages when no text layers are selected
Added feedback when no valid numeric values are found

plugins.name: Font Theme
plugins.description:
Not all fonts that go well together match the theme of your design. This AI powered plugin lets you describe your design and its intended audience and then suggests font pairs that match the theme you entered. You can also simply just type in the vibe or feeling you want the font to evoke.


The best part? You can save the fonts and all their weights as text styles in your Figma with the click of a button!


The text styles will save the font weights as numbers because that's how developers code font weights. This will ease the communication with your developers because you'll get familiar with how they refer to font weights.
plugins.tagline: Search for font pairs to match the feeling of your design.

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

plugins.tagline: Join FigJam activities from anywhere! Run sessions anybody can join from any device.

plugins.name: ËßíËêΩËâ∫ÊúØÂÆ∂
plugins.description:
In the new version of "Corner Artist," I've added a language switch feature between Chinese and English. Here, you can freely switch to your preferred language as needed.


The new version optimizes the user experience, making the overall UI more refined and convenient.


By clicking the button, you can randomly switch to your favorite gradient colors.

Additionally, the new version introduces a "Random Corner Radius" feature, allowing you to choose the layer you want to modify and adjust the corner radius strength.


Here, the higher the value, the smaller the corner radius strength.


I‚Äôve used the superellipse corner radius formula:

|x/a|^n + |y/b|^n = 1

When n = 2, it‚Äôs a regular ellipse;

When n < 2, it‚Äôs a superellipse;

The smaller the value of n, the closer the corners are to right angles.


For those interested, you can explore the formula on your own; I‚Äôll post it in the comments.

When you choose a corner radius strength less than 1, you'll also receive stars as a bonus.


That's about it for the new features. Feel free to experience and save them!
plugins.tagline: Making the overall UI more refined and convenient.

plugins.name: Geometric Tile Pattern SVG Generator
plugins.description:
Geometric Pattern Generator is a Figma plugin for creating beautiful, customizable geometric patterns. Built for designers who need professional-quality patterns fast, this plugin provides generation with granular control.


Key Features:


  1. Smart Generation: Instantly create unique patterns with randomized settings or manually adjust rows, columns, block size, colors, and big blocks chances
  2. Multiple Export Options: Download as PNG or SVG, or insert patterns directly into your Figma canvas as vector or raster graphics
  3. Developer-Friendly: View and copy HTML & CSS code, raw SVG markup, or URL-encoded versions for seamless web integration
  4. Smooth Workflow: Intuitive interface with real-time preview, smooth animations, and one-click generation


Perfect for creating backgrounds, textures, brand elements, or decorative graphics. Generate backgrounds for apps, websites, presentations, or print materials, get professional geometric patterns that would take hours to create manually ‚Äì in just seconds.

From concept to code, this plugin bridges the gap between design and development, making it essential for modern design workflows.

plugins.name: Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless
plugins.description:
Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless

This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design system variables and Penpot's design tokens, allowing seamless migration of your local variables.


How It Works

The plugin connects to Figma's Variables API to extract local variable collections and transform them into Penpot's token format. Here's the process:


  1. Collection Discovery: Upon launch, the plugin scans your Figma file for all variable collections and presents them in a selectable list.
  2. Intelligent Mapping: The converter handles various Figma variable types (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) and maps them to Penpot's token system, including:
  3. Variable mode conversion to Penpot themes
  4. Proper handling of variable references
  5. Special formatting of colors (HEX and RGBA)
  6. Nested structure preservation
  7. Token Organization: The plugin creates a structured Penpot token JSON with:
  8. Themes based on your variable collections and modes
  9. Proper metadata for Penpot compatibility
  10. Dependency management between collections
  11. Clean Output: The result is a downloadable JSON file ready to be imported into Penpot's design system.


Something is not working or you have suggestion for new feature? Submit feedback


üéâ Bonus: Publish your designs directly to websites with Detachless ‚Äì no coding needed! üíªüåê

plugins.name: Data Bloom
plugins.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

üá¶üáø Azerbaijani, üá∫üá∏ English (USA), üá©üá™ German, üá∞üáø Kazakh, üá∞üá¨ Kyrgyz, üá∑üá∫ Russian, üáπüá∑ Turkish, üáπüá≤ Turkmen, üá∫üá¶ Ukrainian, üá∫üáø Uzbek


Available data types:

üé≤ Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

üë´üèª Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

ü§™ Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

üìû Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

üí≥ Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

‚≠êÔ∏è Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

üìÜ Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

üìÜ Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

üìÜ Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

üíº Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

üé® Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you‚Äôre designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


‚ú¶ Lightning-fast generation

‚ú¶ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

‚ú¶ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

‚ú¶ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace ‚Äúlorem ipsum‚Äù forever ‚Äî grow your designs with Data Bloom.


üå± How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click ‚ÄúGenerate Data‚Äù and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.

Frame Manager helps you maintain clean and well-organized Figma files by providing essential tools for working with frames.

Key Features:

This plugin checks your Figma designs and highlights potential issues before uploading them as templates into Frontify. It‚Äôs designed to improve your template creation and management experience ‚Äî making the integration between Figma and Frontify more seamless.


Issues

We‚Äôre continuously refining and expanding the list of checks. This initial release focuses on the most common issues, with more to come. As we improve template import capabilities, some checks may also be retired.


  1. Auto-layout frames

  3. Frames with image fills
  4. Text case transformations
  5. Image filters
  6. Mixed text styles within a single text element

  8. Empty pages
  9. Slice layers
  10. Flip transformations
  11. OpenType features
  12. Hanging punctuation

plugins.name: Layer Name Lister
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that provides a hierarchical view of selected layers and their children. This plugin makes it easy to copy layer names with their complete hierarchy or simple structure for documentation, handoff, or reference purposes.


Also pretty useful if the layers need to be fed to an LLM for cross checking against a checklist of fields that need to be included in the UI (that's why I developed this plugin)


Features

- Recursive Layer Traversal: Lists all selected layers and recursively shows their children

- Multiple Output Formats:

- Full Paths: Shows complete hierarchical paths of each layer

- Simple Names: Shows only the layer names without parent paths

- JSON Format: Structured data format including layer IDs, types, and hierarchy

- Cycle Detection: Avoids infinite loops with automatic cycle detection

- Copy to Clipboard: One-click copy of the entire layer hierarchy

- Live Updates: Automatically updates when selection changes

- Resizable Interface: Adjust the plugin window size to your needs

- Performance Optimized: Handles large layer structures efficiently with batch processing


Outputs

Full Paths (Default)

Frame 1
Frame 1 / Button
Frame 1 / Button / Label
Frame 1 / Button / Icon
Frame 1 / Content
Frame 1 / Content / Title
Frame 1 / Content / Description


Simple Names

Frame 1
Button
Label
Icon
Content
Title
Description


JSON Format

[
{
"id": "1:2",
"name": "Frame 1",
"type": "FRAME",
"path": "Frame 1",
"level": 0,
"children": [
{
"id": "1:3",
"name": "Button",
"type": "INSTANCE",
"path": "Frame 1 / Button",
"level": 1,
"children": [...]
},
...
]
}
]
plugins.tagline: A plugin that will give you a plain text list of the layers you have selected (incl. children)

plugins.name: Text binder for AI
plugins.description:
Text Binder for AI

A LLM-optimized plugin that lets you enhance text content with AI while preserving your Figma designs. Built with AI guardrails, this plugin safely extracts, processes, and updates text across multiple frames without breaking layouts or losing design fidelity.


‚ú® Key Features

üéØ AI-Ready Content Extraction

  1. Extract text with reference tags for LLM processing
  2. Maintain exact positioning and styling information
  3. Process multiple frames simultaneously
  4. Built-in prompts and guardrails for AI safety


üîÑ Validated Content Updates

  1. Preview AI-generated changes before applying
  2. Intelligent length validation for layout preservation
  3. Real-time status checks for each text element
  4. Clear warnings for potential layout impacts


üöÄ Getting Started

  1. Select your target frames
  2. Extract text with AI-friendly reference tags
  3. Use any LLM while maintaining the safety tags
  4. Review changes with automatic validation
  5. Apply updates with confidence

plugins.name: Easily Name output
plugins.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "‚ñº". For example: "‚ñºpage-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "‚ñº" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).

plugins.name: Zero Me
plugins.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus

plugins.name: Storylane: Turn Figma into AI-interactive demos
plugins.description:
From Figma screens to killer product demos - powered by AI


Convert your Figma designs into interactive product demos in just a few clicks. Storylane lets you build personalized, AI-enhanced demos directly from your Figma frames - ready for sales, marketing, and presales teams to share across channels.


How it works?

1. Download and open the Storylane plugin

Install the Storylane plugin and open it in your Figma file.

2. Choose which Figma frames to export

Select All frames or just the ones you've highlighted.

3. Pick your destination and click ‚ÄúCreate New Demo"

plugins.name: TRANS-AI
plugins.description:
TRANS-AI helps designers create multilingual designs by translating text layers and automatically adjusting layouts for right-to-left languages.


Key Features:

  1. Translate selected text layers using OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini API (bring your own API key)
  2. One-click layout conversion between RTL and LTR designs
  3. Option to automatically adjust layouts when translating to/from RTL languages
  4. Exclude specific layers from translation using the layer name filter
  5. Preserves text formatting while converting layouts


Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.
plugins.tagline: Go global in seconds! AI-powered translation with smart RTL/LTR layout conversion.

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description:
Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.


Key Features:


  1. Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.
  2. Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.
  3. Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.
  4. Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.
  5. Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.

plugins.name: RTS CopyBookCreator
plugins.description:
The plugin pulls all texts from selected frames and creates a CSV-file. The CSV will have 4 columns to help you organize your copybook. These columns are: Name of the Frame, Name of the Group, Name of the Text-Style, Text. If you organize your designs accordingly, you'll get a neatly structured Copybook.


Important: The plugin uses semicolons as delimiter, so that Excel can show the CSV properly.
plugins.tagline: Pulls all texts from your figma designs and creates a csv file.
